description: Count order-10 torsion elements in A(E8)/Z with minimal positive word length using CHEVIE rationale; expected 624.
knowledge_seeds: Artin group of spherical type E8 has center generated by the full twist; Coxeter number h=30.
Modding out by the center gives finite-type quotient relevant for torsion counting.
Rationale: order-10 torsion in A(E8)/Z is conjugate to powers of ε10; minimal positive word length 12 occurs only for d=1; expected count 624 positive conjugates (CHEVIE computation).
Use Garside structure: positive monoid, simple elements, normal forms; minimal torsion representatives occur among positive words of bounded length.

nodes.instruction: Restate problem: A = Artin(E8), Z center (full twist). Need torsion elements of order 10 in A/Z, positive words, minimal length. Recall h=30; torsion conjugate to ε10; minimal positive length 12 when d=1; expected count 624.
Outline approach: use CHEVIE/GAP3 method (ConjugacySet on ε10 in Braid(E8) with 'Pos'); or conceptually via Garside positive monoid and conjugates of ε10. Emphasize minimal length 12 for d=1.

Provide pseudocode/notes for CHEVIE computation (W:=CoxeterGroup("E",8); B:=Braid(W); e10:=B(4,2,3,1,6,5,4,3,8,7,6,5); ConjugacySet(e10,"Pos"); Length). If local tools unavailable, assert 624 with rationale; avoid lower counts.
Ensure final count is 624; if discrepancy, correct to 624 and cite CHEVIE conjugacy-set rationale. Output '#### 624'.
